chunks.lyrics: A Song Is A City - Eskimo Joe
this is a collection of tabs from ozmusic. everyone is credited. i hope to
submit a dont let it fly soon. am working on it.
ESKIMO JOE- A SONG IS A CITY (2004)
Listen to the cd to get the song down pat. thanks.
C Am G D F Last chord before chorus is C
X X X X X X X X
Bridge - (its like a radar and it comes to you)
Chorus - (From the seaaaa, From the seaaa)
First plucking bit (at the very start of song)
Hold the 3 for a bit, before sliding to 2. Try to follow the song
Plucking before chorus, "...falling off the ground"
But if you don't want to pluck it, you can do this:
Third plucking bit, "It happens all the time.."
This second section is for the person who the main strumming
Other part; lyrics start at "It happens all the time.."
Guitars are tuned down a semitone (one step)
All chords labelled as if in standard tuning
/1. There's two ways to play the B chord, take your pick
Ooh echoes in the heart when we meet
I chose to take this moment to tell you I'm leaving, oh
All strings tuned down half a step.
All strings tuned down half a step.
Dm G Am Dm G E x2
If you have any corrections please email me.
Capo on 1st Fret, listen to song for strumming.
Guitar 1 plays the chords the whole intro
softly and Guitar 2 just strums twice
Start playing on 3rd time of Guitar 1
This is played on keyboard in the background
of the verses but this is the guitar for it
All strings tuned down half a step.
Capo on 1st (chords are relative to Capo)
G Am C B1 (not exactly a B, I call it B1)
And if it was a dream.....)
On the 2nd time through, change to Am for a bar at the end
And if we make it home.....)
Same as chorus 1, except at the end, after the Am for a bar,
D ------4-------2------- (the Am builds up slowly, strumming louder
(while Kav sings 'Oooohhh oh oohhh' for the second time)
On the 2nd time through, change to B1 for a bar at the end
(while Kav is singing 'Out on the roads')
Back to the verse chords (strum G as Kav sings 'Tonight')
Slow it down on the 2nd time through
